message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.RO, cs.AI, cs.GR 

This paper is about learning semantic segmentation from limited manual annotations by enforcing geometric 3D constraints between multiple views. The paper uses RGB-D image sequences of rigid scenes for a 4-class segmentation problem derived from the ScanNet dataset and demonstrates the approach for semantic segmentation of objects on the LabelFusion dataset. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also employs techniques from 'general' semi-supervised learning to the context of semantic segmentation, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning). The use of 3D constraints and RGB-D sequences suggests that it could belong to cs.RO (Robotics and Control) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper could also belong to cs.GR (Graphics) as it deals with segmentation of 3D scenes.
